message.content:
cs.IT, cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.DC, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with a variant of the index coding problem that involves secure and decentralized communication among users. This suggests that the paper could belong to several arXiv CS sub-categories, including Information Theory (cs.IT), Cryptography and Security (cs.CR), Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI), Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC), and Social and Information Networks (cs.SI). Among these, cs.IT and cs.CR are the most likely categories, as the paper deals with information-theoretic and cryptographic aspects of the problem. However, cs.NI, cs.DC, and cs.SI are also relevant, as the paper considers decentralized and networked communication among users.
